item.description:
Our very own Zachary Bos is reading at Boston University's Bay State Underground series this Friday, along with Janet Ruth Young and Christen Enos. Zachary is a wonderful poet and reader; this event is one not to miss!



Friday, October 3rd, 7:00 p.m.

The return of The Bay State Underground!
Sponsored by Boston University
and AGNI Magazine

236 Bay State Road
(BU East T-stop on the Green Line)



Zachary Bos : Zachary, former deputy editor of News from the Republic of Letters , is a founding member of the Boston Poetry Union and the Union 's literary imprint, The Pen & Anvil Press. His poetry has most recently appeared in FULCRUM: a journal of poetry and aesthetics. His current projects include a secular English-language redaction of the Koran; a redacted Bible edition entitled 'HOLY'; and a translation of Vicente Huidobro's 1939 novel, SÃ¡tiro; o, El poder de las palabras.

Janet Ruth Young: Janet graduated from Salem State College, and from the creative writing program at Boston University . Her last novel, The Opposite of Music (2007, Atheneum/Simon & Schuster), garnered enthusiastic reviews from Booklist, School Library Journal, Publishers Weekly, The Denver Post, and The Boston Globe. It won the PEN NewEngland Discovery Award and was a Book Sense Pick, a Borders Original Voices selection, and an American Library Association Best Books forYoung Adults nominee. She is currently at work on her third young adult novel as well as a breakup memoir, Leaving Leonard.

Christen Enos: Christen lives and teaches in Boston . Raised in Massachusetts , she studied film as an undergraduate at New York University and received her MFA in creative writing from Emerson College . She has work forthcoming from The Portland Review and The New Orleans Review.
item.name: Zachary Bos at the Bay State Underground
